title: Massive green 'fireball' spotted flying across the sky above the UK and Ireland

Stunning footage captures the moment a giant green 'fireball' was spotted flying across the sky above the UK and Ireland yesterday.

Irish driver Sean Linehan saw the phenomenon as he was driving near Banteer, in Co Cork at around 7pm.

He also caught the moment on his dashcam and shared it to Twitter as he wrote: "Bright meteor/fireball flashing across the sky.

"Footage doesn't do it justice, very cool."

He is not the only one impressed by the sight.

South Yorkshire man Paul Willows, who was driving from Conisburgh to Rotherham, also witnessed the unexpected meteor in the sky last night.

The 45-year-old said: "I checked back on my cam that I bought new only last week.

"I was delighted that I caught a glimpse of it - I might keep the camera on the sky in future!"

Residents in Hampshire were stunned when they saw the impressive meteor light up the sky at around midnight.

Richard posted the footage on Twitter and said it was the brightest meteor by far out of the 190 detected last night.

According to Astronomy Ireland this sighting was not part of an expected meteor shower.

A spokesman said: "We've had sightings all over the country. From Cork to Clare, Fermanagh to Dublin, Sligo, Galway.

"It wasn’t a firework folks, despite the week that’s in it!

"They don’t make them that big yet. Sounds like a meteor or a fireball.

"Thanks for the reports and keep them coming.

"Meteors are rarely expected. They’re just pieces of rock, or space dust colliding with Earth’s atmosphere and burning up.

"Comets are the ones we can predict."
description: Residents were stunned when a bright meteor lit up the sky in Hampshire, Yorkshire, Cork, and Dublin
